Dear Maria Lessnau:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-2064.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth C alleged that Staff 1 choked him on 5/4/24.
Investigation Documents reviewed:
An incident report by Staff 1 dated 5/4/24 indicated Youth C ran
up to Staff 1 and “head pumped” him. Staff 1 told him to stop.
Youth C kicked, balled up his fist and hit Staff 1 in his face and
bruised Staff 1’s arm. “I had to grab him by his shoulders to pry
him away from me because he was kicking me and digging his
fingernails in my arm. My arm is bleeding, and my jaw is hurting.
The bottom of my lip on the inside is swollen. I walked away after
Youth C let me go.”
An incident report by Staff 2 dated 5/4/24 indicated Youth C
started swinging on Staff 1. Staff 1 grabbed Youth C’s arms to
stop him from attacking him. Youth C became more upset and
kicked and punched more. Staff 1 grabbed his arms again to
protect himself from Youth C assaulting him.
Interviews:
I notified Residential Director of the allegation. She said Staff 1
allegedly choked Youth C and was placed on administrative leave
pending the outcome of the investigation.
I interviewed Complainant via phone. She said she was not at
the facility when Youth C alleged Staff 1 choked him.
I notified Youth C’s Foster Care Worker of the investigation
assignment. He had no additional licensing concerns.
I arrived at the facility on 5/7/24 to interview Youth C. Youth C
was not there and had been transported to a hospital by police for
2

a psychiatric assessment. Later that day, Government Worker
arrived at the facility to interview Youth C and he refused to talk to
her. Government Worker observed no visible marks on his neck
area.
I arrived at the facility to interview Youth C again on 5/8/24. Youth
C was present but refused to be interviewed.
Government Worker and I arrived at the facility again on 5/9/24 to
interview Youth C, but he was not there and had been transported
to the hospital again for another psychiatric assessment.
I interviewed Staff 2 jointly with Government Worker on 5/9/24.
He has worked at the facility for one month. Staff 2 recalled the
morning of 5/4/24. As he entered the big playroom, he said Youth
C was sitting on a couch swinging at Staff 1 who was standing
nearby. “I thought they were playing until Staff 1 grabbed his arm
to stop him from swinging and kicking. Youth C stood and
squared up with Staff 1. They moved together into the small
dining room. I could not see Staff 1’s hands. I saw Youth C drop
or fall to the floor on his own. He was screaming and crying
yelling ‘I can’t breathe’ but nobody was touching him. Staff 1 tried
to help Youth C up.”
I interviewed Staff 1 jointly with Government Worker on 5/9/24.
He has worked at the facility for one year. Staff 1 was last trained
in CPI in May 2023. On the morning of 5/4/24 Staff 1 said Youth C
ran up to him and chest bumped him. Then Youth C headbutted
him, hitting Staff 1’s head. “at first I thought he was playing but
then he went into a rage. He swung at me. I tried to get him off of
me. He hit me in my lip, kicked me in between my legs, dug his
nails into my arm and hit me in my jaw. While trying to pull him
away, I realized my hands were placed on the side of his neck or
shoulder and let go completely. That’s when Youth C fell and
screamed, ‘He’s choking me. He’s choking me.’” Staff 1 did not
escort Youth C from one room to another. He said it was the
momentum of him moving to block Youth C’s blows that caused
them both to move together into the dining room.
After the incident Youth C had no marks or bruises. However,
Staff 1 said he was injured and went to the emergency room.
“When Youth K kicked me between my legs, it was pretty painful.
I went to the doctor because he dug his nails in my arm. I picked
his fingernails out of my skin.” Small, curved scars were observed
on Staff 1’s left forearm.
3

I interviewed Youth P jointly with Government Worker at school
on 5/9/24. He said he saw Youth C hitting Staff 1. “Staff 1 was
telling him to ‘chill out’ and tried to get Youth C off of him. Youth C
kept hitting him. Staff 1 pushed Youth C into a wall in the small
dining room. I heard he cut Staff 1’s arm with his nails. Youth C
claimed Staff 1 choked him, but Staff 1 didn’t.”
I interviewed Youth D jointly with Government Worker at school
on 5/9/24. He saw Youth C “acting up” and hitting Staff 1 but said
that was none of his business. Youth D said nothing more than,
“Staff 1 didn’t do anything wrong. Staff 1 was scratched and
bleeding. Youth C did not get hurt.”
Video:
Video footage shows Youth C leaning back on a sofa with Staff 1
bending over him holding his arms for 12 seconds. Staff 1
releases, Youth C stands and kicks Staff 1’s left leg while
swinging at him. Staff 2 is present and does not assist Staff 1 to
execute a proper physical restraint. Youth C continues swinging
while Staff 1 blocks the blows by extending his arms. Youth C
backs away, Staff 1 approaches him and grabs his shirt at the
shoulder while Youth C pulls away. From Youth C’s right side,
Staff 1 places his left hand at the top of the youth’s shoulder and
slides it up to the back of his neck. Staff 1’s right hand is holding
or touching the top front of Youth C’s body, but the specific
placement of his hand is out of view. Staff 1 appears to move
Youth C into the dining room with both of his hands on Youth C’s
neck. At one point, Youth C’s neck and upper body tilt backward
as if he was pulling away or being pulled back. Staff 1 moves his
hands from Youth C’s neck down his shoulders to his elbows.
Staff 1 releases his right hand and holds Youth C at the top of his
shoulder with his left hand. Youth C drops to the floor and sits.
Staff 1 fully releases, and Youth C continues to swat at Staff 1
from the floor. Staff 1 did not push Youth C into the wall as Youth
P indicated.
Government Worker had no findings.
Analysis Staff 1 held Youth C’s arms while Youth C was leaning back on
the sofa. Staff 1 approached Youth C as he backed away placing
his hand on his upper back then moving it to the back of Youth C’s
neck. Staff 1 turned Youth C and moved him to another room by
the back and sides youth’s neck and shoulders. While he did
utilize improper techniques to escort Youth C, it did not appear
Staff 1 “choked” or applied pressure to the front of Youth C’s neck.
4

Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Behavior management
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4157
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
Description procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
and updated as needed. These shall be available to all residents,
their families, and referring agencies.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 physically restrained and escorted Youth C from one room
to another utilizing improper techniques.
Investigation Document reviewed:
I reviewed the agency’s CPI manual with the approved moves
trained at the facility. There are no approved single-person
escorts or restraints.
Video:
Video footage shows Staff 1 bending over Youth C holding his
arms for 12 seconds. Youth C stands and kicks and swings at
Staff 1. Staff 2 is present and does not assist Staff 1 to execute a
proper physical restraint. As Youth C backs away, Staff 1
approaches him and grabs his shirt at the shoulder. Staff 1 moves
Youth C to another room with both of his hands on the back of
Youth C’s neck, and gradually releases.
Interview:
I spoke with Residential Director on 5/16/24 and she informed
me the staff person who did not assist, Staff 2, resigned.
Analysis After Youth C kicked and swung at him, Staff 1 utilized
unapproved restraint techniques to restrict Youth C’s movements.
CONSULTATION
Singlehandedly holding Youth C’s arms, approaching him as he
backed away, grabbing his shirt and moving him by the back of his
neck are not approved restraint techniques. Once Youth C
became combative, emergency physical restraint was warranted,
and Staff 2 should have assisted Staff 1 in executing a proper
restraint.
5

Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
